titles.title: A resolution to express the sense of the Senate regarding reciprocal trade in agricultural commodities.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 4/9/1987--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Senate that if a foreign country uses import licenses to restrict or prohibit the importation of U.S. agricultural commodities into such country and similar agricultural commodities of such country are imported into the United States free of such restrictions, the President should: (1) give priority in all trade negotiations with such country to the establishment of reciprocal market access agreements for such agricultural commodities; or (2) establish a similar import licensing system for such agricultural commodities.
